title: The old Windows crash
content: My Windows 10 recently crashed and i had to reinstall the OS, needless to say that everything was missing. So i re-install Firefox which i have been using for years with the same account. Re-installed, I synced my account with email and password, And there was nothing to sync, I lost everything and i'm wondering why? Anyone got an answer before i delete this crap forever?
creator: jakmehoff

title: Pressing "Esc" to exit the input method popup will exit the fullscreen
content: 在全屏模式下，如果按Esc以退出输入法的弹窗，会直接退出整个全屏模式。 When I typed something, I may press "Esc" to quit the input method popup. In this case, the fullsreen mod should not be cancelled. For example, look at the attached picture, which is taken when I'm inputing something in the fullscreen mode. In this case, when I press "Esc", the expected behaviour is to close the input method popup without closing the fullscreen mode. The bug has existed for long. I'm using the latest Firefox version for Windows 11.
creator: SolidBlock

title: Time Machine Backup: "Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible."  I found the profile, never re-named it, now what?
content:
I'm restoring from time machine backup in mac and cannot get firefox to work. I have located the profile folder and the error message I get when I try to open firefox is: "Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible."

I do not know where to move the folder to in order to get firefox to work. I did not rename the folder. I went through Library to Application Support to find the profile...now what do I do to get firefox to work? Do I need to move the folder? Where to? Should I just delete the firefox folder in App Support, then import my Chrome profile to Firefox after I download it again? Will that even work?

Thank you for reading!
creator: ryan.b.willis86

title: Mozilla Firefox version for LG Smart TV with WebOS
content: I wonder if any community developer would accept a donation to create a version of Mozilla Firefox for LG Smart TV with WebOS system.
creator: alessandro_ufac
